Article.Abstract: The immunogenicity and protective efficacy of overlapping regions of the protective antigen (PA) polypeptide, cloned and expressed as glutathione S-transferase fusion proteins, have been assessed. Results show that protection can be attributed to individual domains and imply that it is domain 4 which contains the dominant protective epitopes of PA.
Article.ArticleTitle: A recombinant carboxy-terminal domain of the protective antigen of Bacillus anthracis protects mice against anthrax infection.
Article.Affiliations: Dstl, Chemical and Biological Sciences, Porton Down, Salisbury, Wiltshire SP4 0JQ, United Kingdom.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Anthrax Vaccines;Antigens, Bacterial;Bacterial Toxins;Peptide Fragments;Vaccines, Synthetic;anthrax toxin
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Anthrax(mortality; prevention & control); Anthrax Vaccines(immunology); Antigens, Bacterial; Bacterial Toxins(immunology); Female; Mice; Peptide Fragments(immunology); Protein Structure, Tertiary; Vaccination; Vaccines, Synthetic(immunology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The peptide numbering corresponds to the mature protein with the signal peptide cleaved.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST. Mice were challenged i.p. with 10^5 or 10^6 spores of B. anthracis STI strain [equivalent to 10^2 or 10^3 minimum lethal doses (MLDs), respectively] 42 days after booster immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Three of 5 mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope survived 14 days postchallenge with 10^2 MLDs and 1 of 5 survived after challenge with 10^3 MLDs. Only 1 of 5 mice immunized with the epitope cleaved from GST survived 14 days postchallenge with 10^2 MLDs and 2 of 5 mice survived after challenge with 10^3 MLDs.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST. Blood samples were collected 37 days after the primary immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST produced antibodies to recombinant PA. The predominant subclass was IgG1, indicating a Th2-biased response. The antibody response was 3- to 4-fold less than the optimal response obtained after immunization with domains 1-4 coupled to GST.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The peptide numbering corresponds to the mature protein with the signal peptide cleaved.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST. Mice were challenged i.p. with 10^5 or 10^6 spores of B. anthracis STI strain [equivalent to 10^2 or 10^3 minimum lethal doses (MLDs), respectively] 42 days after booster immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: All mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST survived 14 days postchallenge with 10^2 MLDs or 10^3 MLDs. All mice in groups immunized with fusion proteins containing domain 4 were fully protected against challenge with STI spores. The authors conclude that domain 4 contains the dominant protective epitopes of PA.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST. Blood samples were collected 37 days after the primary immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope or the epitope cleaved from GST produced antibodies to recombinant PA. The predominant subclass was IgG1, indicating a Th2-biased response. The antibody response was 4-fold less than the optimal response obtained after immunization with domains 1-4 coupled to GST.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The peptide numbering corresponds to the mature protein with the signal peptide cleaved.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were challenged i.p. with 10^5 or 10^6 spores of B. anthracis STI strain [equivalent to 10^2 or 10^3 minimum lethal doses (MLDs), respectively] 42 days after booster immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: All mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope survived 14 days postchallenge with 10^3 MLDs. All mice in groups immunized with fusion proteins containing domain 4 were fully protected against challenge with STI spores. The authors conclude that domain 4 contains the dominant protective epitopes of PA.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood samples were collected 37 days after the primary immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope produced antibodies to recombinant PA. The predominant subclass was IgG1, indicating a Th2-biased response. The antibody response was 4-fold less than the optimal response obtained after immunization with domains 1-4 coupled to GST.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The peptide numbering corresponds to the mature protein with the signal peptide cleaved.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood samples were collected 37 days after the primary immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope did not produce antibodies to recombinant PA. The optimal antibody response was obtained after immunization with domains 1-4 coupled to GST. Removal of domain 1a from fusion proteins reduced antibody titers.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Administration in vivo to prevent or reduce disease
FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were challenged i.p. with 10^5 or 10^6 spores of B. anthracis STI strain [equivalent to 10^2 or 10^3 minimum lethal doses (MLDs), respectively] 42 days after booster immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: One of 5 mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope survived 14 days postchallenge with 10^2 MLDs. Removal of domain 1a from fusion proteins reduced protection against challenge with STI spores.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The peptide numbering corresponds to the mature protein with the signal peptide cleaved.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood samples were collected 37 days after the primary immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope produced antibodies to recombinant PA. The predominant subclass was IgG1, indicating a Th2-biased response. The antibody response was 7-fold less than the optimal response obtained after immunization with domains 1-4 coupled to GST.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized with 10 µg of protein adsorbed to Alhydrogel on days 1 and 28.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Three of 5 mice immunized with a fusion protein of GST-epitope survived 14 days postchallenge with 10^2 MLDs. Removal of domain 1a from fusion proteins reduced protection against challenge with STI spores.
